intro: Juncus kraussii subsp. austerus, commonly known as the coastal rush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or coastal environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, greenish flowers in dense spikes. It is well adapted to saline and windy conditions, making it a common species in coastal dunes. Its ecological role includes stabilizing sand dunes and providing habitat for various small organisms.
